definition: to pull/to turn (sth) around/to turn around (a situation)/to recoup
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
to pull out/to pull a lever

sentences.english: I was a point from losing this match, and now I managed to come back.
sentences.chinese: 就差一分輸掉比賽，現在我設法將比分扳了回來。

sentences.english: I've benefited a lot from your advice.
Like Joey's constant knuckle-cracking isn't annoying?
sentences.chinese: 像喬伊，常扳指關節就不惹人厭嗎？

sentences.english: First, public speaking is more highly structured than conversation.
sentences.chinese: 首先，公開演講比扳談要有更高的組織結構性。

sentences.english: In conversation, almost without thinking about it, you employ a wide range of skills.
sentences.chinese: 在扳談中，你已經不假思考地使用良多技巧。
扳關節會阻礙到大家嗎？

sentences.english: I talked to him on the internal telephone.
sentences.chinese: 本人在內部德律風上與他扳談。

sentences.english: Chandler began in the third quarter after two and a contribution to the score back to level 51.
sentences.chinese: 錢德勒在第三節開始後就貢獻兩分把比分扳爲51平。

sentences.english: When they equalised we were very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 當他們扳平時，我們非常緊張。

sentences.english: As soon as black 91 resourcefully pull in the right bottom, snatches to the value huge end game.
sentences.chinese: 黑91又在右下角機敏地一扳，搶到價值巨大的官子。
扳關節會影響到大家嗎？

sentences.english: Use an adjustable strap-wrench to remove over-tight or rusted caps.
sentences.chinese: 使用可調套扳來移動過緊或生鏽的帽子。

sentences.english: He ran his fingers through her hair and turned her head around again.
sentences.chinese: 他用手指穿過她的頭髮，又一次將她的頭扳了過來。

to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to make an about-turn/to reverse one's direction, policy, sequence etc/to turn things on their head

to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
